member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.AddWATResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary:
Adds one or more tags to the specified resource.
The WorkloadArn parameter can be either a workload ARN or a custom lens ARN.

para.para: The tags for the resource.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.AddWATResourceTagCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The cmdlet doesn't have a return value by default. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.WellArchitected.Model.TagResourceResponse). Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.AddWATResourceTagCmdlet.PassThru
member.summary: Changes the cmdlet behavior to return the value passed to the WorkloadArn parameter. The -PassThru parameter is deprecated, use -Select '^WorkloadArn' instead. This parameter will be removed in a future version.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.AddWATResourceTagCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.ExportWATLensCmdlet
member.summary:
Export an existing lens.
Lenses are defined in JSON. For more information, see JSON format specification in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide. Only the owner of a lens can export it.
Disclaimer
Do not include or gather personal identifiable information (PII) of end users or other identifiable individuals in or via your custom lenses. If your custom lens or those shared with you and used in your account do include or collect PII you are responsible for: ensuring that the included PII is processed in accordance with applicable law, providing adequate privacy notices, and obtaining necessary consents for processing such data.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: The lens version to be exported.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.ExportWATLensCmdlet.Select
member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is 'LensJSON'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.WellArchitected.Model.ExportLensResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.WellArchitected.Model.ExportLensResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.ExportWATLensCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.ImportWATLensCmdlet
member.summary:
Import a new lens.
The lens cannot be applied to workloads or shared with other Amazon Web Services accounts until it's published with CreateLensVersion
Lenses are defined in JSON. For more information, see JSON format specification in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.
A custom lens cannot exceed 500 KB in size.
Disclaimer
Do not include or gather personal identifiable information (PII) of end users or other identifiable individuals in or via your custom lenses. If your custom lens or those shared with you and used in your account do include or collect PII you are responsible for: ensuring that the included PII is processed in accordance with applicable law, providing adequate privacy notices, and obtaining necessary consents for processing such data.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: The JSON representation of a lens.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: Tags to associate to a lens.

member.summary: Use the -Select parameter to control the cmdlet output. The default value is '*'. Specifying -Select '*' will result in the cmdlet returning the whole service response (Amazon.WellArchitected.Model.ImportLensResponse). Specifying the name of a property of type Amazon.WellArchitected.Model.ImportLensResponse will result in that property being returned. Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.name: P:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.ImportWATLensCmdlet.Force
member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.NewWATLensShareCmdlet
member.summary:
Create a lens share.
The owner of a lens can share it with other Amazon Web Services accounts and IAM users in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Shared access to a lens is not removed until the lens invitation is deleted.
Disclaimer
By sharing your custom lenses with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your custom lenses available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared custom lenses even if you delete the custom lenses from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.NewWATLensVersionCmdlet
member.summary:
Create a new lens version.
A lens can have up to 100 versions.
After a lens has been imported, create a new lens version to publish it. The owner of a lens can share the lens with other Amazon Web Services accounts and IAM users in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Only the owner of a lens can delete it.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: Set to true if this new major lens version.

para.para: The version of the lens being created.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.NewWATWorkloadShareCmdlet
member.summary:
Create a workload share.
The owner of a workload can share it with other Amazon Web Services accounts and IAM users in the same Amazon Web Services Region. Shared access to a workload is not removed until the workload invitation is deleted.
For more information, see Sharing a Workload in the Well-Architected Tool User Guide.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.RegisterWATLensCmdlet
member.summary:
Associate a lens to a workload.
Up to 10 lenses can be associated with a workload in a single API operation. A maximum of 20 lenses can be associated with a workload.
Disclaimer
By accessing and/or applying custom lenses created by another Amazon Web Services user or account, you acknowledge that custom lenses created by other users and shared with you are Third Party Content as defined in the Amazon Web Services Customer Agreement.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

Specifying -Select '^ParameterName' will result in the cmdlet returning the selected cmdlet parameter value.

member.summary: This parameter overrides confirmation prompts to force the cmdlet to continue its operation. This parameter should always be used with caution.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.RemoveWATLensCmdlet
member.summary:
Delete an existing lens.
Only the owner of a lens can delete it. After the lens is deleted, Amazon Web Services accounts and IAM users that you shared the lens with can continue to use it, but they will no longer be able to apply it to new workloads.
Disclaimer
By sharing your custom lenses with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your custom lenses available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared custom lenses even if you delete the custom lenses from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.

para.para: The status of the lens to be deleted.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.RemoveWATLensShareCmdlet
member.summary:
Delete a lens share.
After the lens share is deleted, Amazon Web Services accounts and IAM users that you shared the lens with can continue to use it, but they will no longer be able to apply it to new workloads.
Disclaimer
By sharing your custom lenses with other Amazon Web Services accounts, you acknowledge that Amazon Web Services will make your custom lenses available to those other accounts. Those other accounts may continue to access and use your shared custom lenses even if you delete the custom lenses from your own Amazon Web Services account or terminate your Amazon Web Services account.

member.name: T:Amazon.PowerShell.Cmdlets.WAT.RemoveWATResourceTagCmdlet
member.summary:
Deletes specified tags from a resource.
The WorkloadArn parameter can be either a workload ARN or a custom lens ARN.
To specify multiple tags, use separate tagKeys parameters, for example:
DELETE /tags/WorkloadArn?tagKeys=key1&tagKeys=key2

para.para: A list of tag keys. Existing tags of the resource whose keys are members of this list are removed from the resource.

summary.para: The service has not provided documentation for this parameter; please refer to the service's API reference documentation for the latest available information.
